alert.note: Alert for Wakulla (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 05 at 11:30AM EST until December 06 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Florida... Sopchoppy River near Sopchoppy (FR 343) affecting Wakulla County. For the Sopchoppy River...including Sopchoppy (FR 343)...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sopchoppy River near Sopchoppy (FR 343). * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 28.0 feet, Parsons Lane, Mount Beasor Road, and Greenough Road in vicinity of the Painted Bridge are flooded and likely impassable above this level. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 28.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:30 AM EST Tuesday was 30.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this evening and continue falling to 20.1 feet tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 28.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 28.9 feet on 02/11/1986. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1100 PM EST.
